---
category: news
title: "Male/female plumage differences in thrushes promote species recognition"
excerpt: "In 1868, the naturalist Charles Darwin wrote that differences in plumage coloration between male and female birds of the same species were likely the result of sexual selection: Female birds—he used the peahen and peacock as an example—seemed to prefer the showiest males."
